The Node.js code provided is a module export statement. It imports the default export from the `./index` module and then re-exports it. This pattern is often used when you want to streamline importing by re-exporting a module's default export from another file. It allows users to import the default functionality from a different entry point without having to directly reference the original module file.

Here is a possible rewrite of this Node.js code:

```javascript
"use strict";

// Import the default export from the './index' module
const defaultExport = require("./index").default;

// Re-export the default export for use in other modules
module.exports = defaultExport;
```
